President Trump says he will leave a landmark arms control agreement the U.S signed with the former Soviet Union thing Russia is violating the pack and that it's preventing us from developing new weapons
The Nineteen eighty seven agreement prohibits the U.S and Russia from possessing producing or test flying ground launched cruise missiles with a range of up to three to four hundred miles
Nearly eight thousand customers in the Florida Panhandle are still without power ten days after hurricane Michael struck from Panama City NPR's Debbie Elliott reports
Recovery is slow going because of the scope and intensity of the destruction crews are working to restore phone service electricity and water and sewer systems mark Bowe and his chief of emergency services for hard hit bay county
Will get it back um you'll never be the way it was but you know we'll make it into the best community that we can and move forward that's all human beings can do

The Milwaukee Brewers are playing the LA Dodgers game seven of the national league championship series the score last check is to one Dodgers in the top of the six you're listening to NPR News from Washington
In Syria ISIS has released to women and four children who were among dozens of hostages militants have been holding captive for months NPR's Ruth Sherlock reports the move is reportedly the result of a deal struck by the Syrian regime
In July just yeah I just attack an ethnically dreams vintage in southern Syria killing hundreds of inhabitants and taking hostage dozens of women and children local residents put pressure on the Syrian regime to find a solution
Now months later Syrian activists and the Syrian Observatory for human rights monitors to say the regime has struck a deal with ISIS agreeing to pay millions of dollars in rent since ... gauge in a prisoner swap
The Syrian Government has not confined to terms with that report to deal Syrian state television characterized the hostage releases being the result of a tight siege and paint on the extreme is by government treats and more of the hostages out to be free season reached channel and pennies they rate
A frozen food and packing company in Minnesota is recalling more than ... twelve thousand pounds of ready to eat pork and chicken products authorities say the meat contains vegetables that may have been contaminated with salmonella and listeria
Us agriculture department says the products were shipped from buddies kitchen and sold in Arizona California Georgia Illinois Minnesota Missouri and New Jersey the USDA says buddies vegetable supplier found the problem it so far no reports of illnesses have been filed
I'm Janine hurts and you're listening to NPR News from Washington
Support for NPR comes from NPR stations other contributors include the George guns foundation working to make Cleveland and northeast Ohio more globally competitive livable sustainable and just more information available at gun foundation dot org and the corporation for public broadcasting
